clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Exercise Training on Mechanoreflex and Metaboreflex Control in Heart Failure Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Exercise Training on Mechanoreflex and Metaboreflex Control of Muscle Sympathetic Nerve Activity in Heart Failure Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo
Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that exercise training would improve the mechanoreflex and metaboreflex control in heart failure patients.

primary_outcome.description: Mechanoreceptors were activated by passive exercise and metaboreceptors by post-exercise circulatory arrest
Muscular evaluation will be done by muscle gene expression

secondary_outcome.description: Functional Capacity will be determined by cardiopulmonary exercise testing
Forearm blood flow will be assessed by venous occlusion plethysmography
Blood pressure will be monitored non-invasively
